title: Retailer
description:
Job Title: Retailer

Reports to: General Manager

With a projected 1,000 cafes in the United States by 2030, Paris Baguette is one of the fastest-growing neighborhood bakery cafés in the world. Paris Baguette’s mission is to bring expertly crafted baked and brewed goods through a warm and welcoming bakery café experience that delivers joy to everyone.

At Paris Baguette, we serve up graciousness and are happy to put the needs of others first. We are attentive and accommodating to our guests and to each other. We mix in a little love, comfort and compassion into our work every step of the way. We work diligently with a dedication to quality at our core, taking ownership of our actions and decisions. We hold ourselves accountable to our word. We face challenges head on, and when the bar is set high, we have the conviction to clear it with confidence. We pour our heart into everything we do.

It is why pastries to us are not just a product, they are our passion. And why our bakers, cakers, sandwich team members and baristas go further every day to perfect their craft, serving up freshly-baked breads, delicious coffee and cakes more than worthy of their pedestals.

If you are someone who has heart, wants to spread joy and is ready to rise to the occasion, we are looking for you to join our growing team!

-------

WHAT WE ARE HUNGRY FOR

Our Retailers are brand ambassadors who genuinely love our food, love our brand and are customer obsessed! They pay attention to our guests, to their role, to detail and to our product quality. They are happy to see you and happier to serve you! Our Retailers bring a smile to your face because we believe the world needs more moments of joy.

KNOWLEDGE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

 Providing excellent customer service to all customers that come into the establishment or call for orders following Paris Baguette’s high standard of excellence

 Check quality of all the products for displays and organize rotation of displays for all pastries and desserts

 Make beverages on the basis and demand during operating business hours and prepare coffee

 Always keep all areas of the store clean while operating during business hours

 Refill and organize all pasties and beverages on display

 Work with a high sense of urgency, honesty, integrity, and as efficiently as possible.

 Assisting guests with any inquiries and educating guests on menu items and any special promotions

 Operate POS system (Toast) and perform tasks such as cash handling and credit card processing with attention to accuracy

 Openness to learn about our quality products, specialty menu items, and coffee

 Pay attention to guests and greet guests by making eye contact, smiling and spreading joy!

 Understanding the guest is the center of it all

 Answering questions and assisting guests with order decisions and processes

 Knowing how to suggestively sell to enhance the guest experience and increasing sales

 Always happy to help! Our retailers want our guests and their fellow team members to feel comfortable and welcome coming to us for assistance. Smiling, spreading joy and being positive with every interaction are non-negotiables

WHAT YOU NEED TO HAVE

 Minimum of 1-2 years of Retail, Customer Service and food handling experience.

 Minimum High School Diploma/GED or Some College.

 Positive and passionate attitude!

 High sense of integrity and ownership.

 Basic math skills (add, subtract, multiply, divide).

 Able to lift up to 25 lbs.

 Time management, ability to prioritize and follow direction.

 Adherence to food safety guidelines.

 Proficient on Point of Sale systems, currently Toast. Understand the importance of cash handling and accuracy of transactions.

 Feedback is a gift! We can only learn, grow and improve our service if we hear and understand what it is our customers are telling us.

 High emotional intelligence with the ability to work with diverse teams by being highly empathetic, intuitive, self-motivated and driven.

 Teams Win! Has to be a team player who fosters a collaborative and engaged environment.

 Being a Brand Ambassador, with an excellent knowledge of and commitment to Paris Baguette’s Mission, Vision, Brand Values and Culture.

SWEET BENEFITS

 Flexible work schedule

 Competitive compensation

 Discounted meals during your shift

 Free Cake for your Birthday

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $16.00 - $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: 18 – 48 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount

Shift:

* 10 hour shift
* 8 hour shift

Ability to Relocate:

* Yonkers, NY 10710: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Director - Financial Modeling & Analytics
description:
Position Title
Director - Financial Modeling & Analytics
Location
New York/1400 Broadway/114025
Job Summary
The Director, Financial Modeling & Analytics Manager (Director, FMA) is responsible for managing a team of financial risk modelers and analysts that develop and execute quantitative macroeconomic models required for capital stress testing, CECL loss estimation, and other financial risk forecasts. In addition, the Director, FMA is responsible for providing enhanced analytic support to the various risk management disciplines within The Capital Planning and Stress Testing Office. These responsibilities and outputs are to conform with all regulatory expectations of a CCAR compliant financial institution.  

  

Pay Range: $195,131.78 - $268,306.19 - $341,480.61
Pay Range: Local Minimum Wage - $0.00 - $0.00
Job Responsibilities:* Oversee and manage the development, deployment, and use of credit risk, PPNR, operational risk, and other models, analytic tools or calculators required for CCAR stress testing and CECL forecasts.
	+ Responsible for the entire model lifecycle of collecting data, building and implementing models and performance tracking.
	+ Subject matter expert relating to model conceptual soundness, development, and industry practices.
	+ Conducting econometric and statistical analysis of credit risk and operational data.
	+ Performing stress testing, back-testing, sensitivity analysis, scenario analysis, benchmarking, etc.
	+ Keeping abreast with latest research and white papers on model methodology and regulatory requirements.
	+ Responsible for conceptual soundness of all stress testing models, data quality and integrity as well as model assumptions and stress test results.
	+ Conduct and participate in Effective Challenge sessions of models, scenarios, and analysis.
* Oversee and manage the analysis and design of macroeconomic scenarios and market sector data, sourced from third-party data and forecast providers.
	+ Scenario design and data preparation of new and emerging stress testing initiatives (i.e. Rent Reg Reform, Climate Change, Pandemic, Banking Crises, etc.).
	+ Scenario design and data preparation of reasonable and supportable scenarios utilized for CECL ACL forecasting.
	+ Trend and Vintage analysis of macroeconomic history and forecast scenarios in accordance with tracking key macroeconomic risks for management decision support, model inputs, and ad-hoc analysis.
* Interact with management, 2nd and 3rd line risk management functions, independent auditors, and regulatory agency personnel to ensure FMA’s models, procedures, controls, and data meet all regulatory expectations of a CCAR compliant financial institution.
	+ Report to the Director of Capital Planning & Stress Testing for strategic direction, stress testing requirements, results and reports.
	+ Participate in the CECL Core Team to perform scenario design, model execution, and reporting as required for the Bank’s quarterly ACL financial calculations.
	+ Responsible for direct interaction with regulators as it relates to targeted reviews and inquiries.
	+ Responsible for direct interaction with independent auditors as it relates to certification and auditing of CECL and SOX compliant ALLL calculations.
	+ Produce management, committee, and regulatory compliance materials.
	+ Review and contribute to associated corporate policies and procedures.
* Plan, implement, and perform model execution and reporting in compliance with all Bank policies and procedures.
	+ Integration of new portfolios, products, and models as a consequence of business changes (i.e. Flagstar and Signature acquisitions, etc.).
	+ Evolution of data, models, and procedures for regulatory or financial market changes (i.e. SOFR, BASEL III, CECL, banking liquidity reforms, etc.).
	+ Establish governance and controls within the entire model execution process.
	+ Monitoring and accommodation of vendor data, portal, and model changes (i.e. Moody’s, CoStar, S&P, etc.).
	+ Monitoring and testing of system and software changes initiated by either FMA or IT (i.e. SAS Server, SQL Server, Tableau Server, etc.).
	+ Monitoring of disk space utilization and archival of internal software assets (retention of past model execution data and runs, past model development data and programs, etc.).
	+ Model Assumptions and Overrides Analysis and Support.
	+ Model Execution Disaster Recover Testing.
* Oversee and manage the following ongoing departmental management functions:
	+ Team management including recruiting and performance appraisals.
	+ Review and attestation of all Model Development Documentation (MRM requirement).
	+ Review and attestation of all Model Execution Controls (SOX requirement).
	+ Review of all model execution outputs during production runs.
	+ Completion of annual, semi-annual, and quarterly compliance reporting (i.e. quarterly Model Overlay reports, ERM Risk Management Surveys, End User Computing Survey, KPMG annual and quarterly control walkthroughs, Audit’s annual inventory of operational procedures, etc.).
	+ Vendor and contract management for data and software licenses (Moody’s, CoStar, Trepp, Tableau, Vendor Risk Assessments, etc.).
	+ Security permissions for FMA SQL Server databases, network folders and server directories.
	+ Coordination of FMA resources in support of ongoing business activities such as quarterly CECL runs and Enterprise-Wide Stress Tests
	+ Tactical and Strategic planning to anticipate and position the department for expected future needs.
* Oversee and manage the following other ongoing activities:
	+ Ongoing monitoring and research of the macroeconomic and market economics (i.e. reviewing Moody’s, S&P, CoStar, and other economic news sources, identifying potential needs, interpretation of idiosyncratic scenarios, etc.).
	+ Ongoing research into relevant data, modeling, and analytic improvements (i.e. Moody’s REIS data evaluation, Trepp benchmarking consortium, Moody’s Data Alliance, etc.).
	+ Ongoing monitoring and participation of data quality and governance issues (i.e. data warehouse and bi-weekly data governance meetings, etc.).


ADDITIONAL ACCOUNTABILITIES* Performs special projects, and additional duties and responsibilities as required.
* Consistently adheres to regulatory and compliance policies and standards linked to the job as listed and complete required compliance trainings. Accountable to maintain compliance with applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations.


Required Qualifications:* Education level required: Master's Degree (or Postgraduate equivalent) preferred in Finance, Data Science, Computer Science, or Mathematics.
* Minimum experience required: 12+ Years in credit risk model development and management, macroeconomic scenario design and forecasting, associated banking regulatory requirements, SOX compliant model execution and operations, CCAR Stress Testing, CECL loss forecasting, strategic planning, quantitative data analytics, project management, technical IT infrastructure development and maintenance, software engineering, professional personnel recruiting and management, vendor-licensed data and model management, presentations, documentation, and training.
* Prior management of a hybrid department comprised of both model development, operations, and quantitative analytics.
* Minimum experience required: 10+ Years interacting with regulatory agencies (i.e. OCC, FRB, FDIC), independent auditors, internal ERM, and MRM departments.


Preferred Qualifications:* Minimum of five (10) years managing Model Developers/Validators.
* Industry experience with retail and commercial banking credit risk model development and execution.
* Experience with statistical techniques used in credit loss models (time series analysis, logistic/linear regression, ARMIA modeling, cash flow modeling).
* Experience with Basel II PD and LGD models.


Job Competencies:* Knowledge of Federal banking stress testing regulations and requirements.
* Knowledge of banking and credit risk modeling including key risk drivers.
* Knowledge of risk management concepts and principles, valuation of basic instruments and basic accounting principles.
* Knowledge of financial markets, interest rates and potential impact of current economic activity.
* Solid understanding and experience in the fundamentals of data analytics with respect to pre-modeling data integrity, data issue mitigation techniques, data validity testing, and other data preparation procedures.
* Demonstrated proficiency in advanced statistical and econometric modeling techniques dealing with primary and secondary time series, cross-sectional, and panel data.
* Proven track record in conceptualizing, designing, developing, backtesting, implementing, and recalibrating statistical and econometric models.
* Demonstrated ability to effectively articulate complex analytical concepts, outcomes, and processes to non-technical business users and the management audience.
* Broad knowledge of and the ability to write and apply advanced business analysis concepts, practices and procedures related to assigned area.
* Advanced proficiency in major statistical computing systems such as SAS and R.
* Computer literate with advanced proficiency in internet navigation, word processing, spreadsheet and database applications.
* Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent project coordination and organizational skills.
* Excellent negotiation skills.
* Strong facilitation, conflict resolution, presentation and problem-solving skills.
* Strong customer service and business focus with an excellent attention to detail.
* Effective research and analysis skills.
* Ability to lead and motivate project team members.
* Ability to work independently and follow through assignments to completion.
* Ability to meet established deadlines.
* Ability to exercise sound judgment.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality.
* Travel requirements: Periodically required for regulatory and management requirements.


Physical demands (ADA): No unusual physical exertion is involved.

title: Employment Success Coordintor
description:
**Position Title**: Employment Success Coordinator

**Position Type**: Full-Time, Hourly, Non-Exempt

**Schedule:** 35 hours/week

**Department/Program**: Graham SLAM

**Direct Supervisor**: Supervisor, SLAM Success Services

**Direct Reports (if any):** WPP Interns

**About Graham Windham**:

In full partnership with families and communities, Graham Windham strives to make a life-altering difference with children, youth, and families who are overcoming some of life’s most difficult challenges and obstacles, by helping to build a strong foundation for life: a safe, loving, permanent family and the opportunity and preparation to thrive in school and in the world. With over 500 full-time employees serving children and families in multiple programs throughout the Bronx, Brooklyn and Harlem, Graham Windham provides an exciting and enriching work experience.

**Program Description**:

The Graham SLAM (Support, Lead, Achieve, Model) program works with youth between the 9th grade and age 26 who are in Graham Windham’s programs including foster care, foster care prevention and community-based afterschool programs. The program aims to put youth on a livable wage path by focusing on their success in high school, college, and career development. The program ‘sticks with’ youth through age 26, or until they are on a living wage career path.

**Principal Objective/Role Overview:**

The Employment Success Coordinator will support SLAM youth in developing a pathway to employment success. They will develop and maintain long-term, cooperative working relationships with private, public, and community employment partners in collaboration with the Graham SLAM team. They will also assist program participants in internship placements and career-oriented employment.

**Job Responsibilities**:

* Create and manage a SLAM employment pathway for youth.
* Develop placements for work experience, work-study, internships, and community service/volunteer opportunities with employers in the private, public, and community sector for youth in the Graham SLAM program.
* Create and maintain a pipeline to entry-level employment internships that give access to direct placements with companies.
* Develop and maintain an internal job bank database.
* Maintain current applications, interview data, and initiate techniques to better serve and match participants with jobs and internships.
* Compile, develop, and maintain file notes, statistical reports, and records with both partners and participants to better understand success rate and trends.
* Stay up to date with job market information that affects youth employment trends.
* Develop and maintain long-term, cooperative working relationships with private, public, and community employment partners.
* Manage all employment and internship related reporting including entering required data into the SLAM database.
* Attend workshops, meetings and training related to workforce opportunities for SLAM youth.
* Work creatively towards increasing retention and maintaining strong participant attendance by facilitating work-readiness workshops. This includes serving as the lead person for Career Club and providing support to SLAM staff who facilitate the workshops.
* Develop and coordinate job placement activities with SLAM Coaches, such as field trips and Workshops.
* Travel to multiple service sites within the program
* Perform other related duties as required by Supervisor.
* Can work with diverse populations (including LGBTQ) and cultures, process information and respond empathically.

**Position Qualifications**:

* Bachelor’s Degree, Master’s Degree preferred
* Two years of experience in workforce development
* Computer literate and conversant with social media

**Salary & Compensation**:

* **Base Salary or Hourly Rate**: $31.60/hour ($57,500.00/year)
* **FLSA** **Status**: Non-Exempt
* **Benefits Eligibility**: This role is eligible to participate in our Performance Based Merit Award program at the end of each fiscal year, and eligible for benefits including health insurance, retirement plans (pension and 403B thrift), career coaching via Bravely, and more!

**EEO Statement**

The Equal Employment Opportunity Policy of Graham Windham (GW) is to provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all associates and job applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. GW hires and promotes individuals solely based on their qualifications for the job to be filled.

Graham Windham believes that associates should be provided with a working environment which enables each associate to be productive and to work to the best of his or her ability. We do not condone or tolerate an atmosphere of intimidation or harassment based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability.

We expect and require the cooperation of all associates in maintaining a discrimination and harassment-free atmosphere.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $57,500.00 per year

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

* Monday to Friday

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Career counseling, job development, or workforce development: 2 years (Required)
* internship management: 2 years (Preferred)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY 11201 (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 50% (Required)

title: Research Analyst
description:
Legal Benchmarking group was first published as a journal in 1982 but is now a full digital title covering financial regulation, M&A, ESG and related areas with a ‘business of law’ legal lens. We provide subscribers with critical insight into how regulatory changes and developments in the legal sector affect law firms’ operations and strategies.
  
  

**JOB TITLE:** Research Analyst
  
  

**REPORTS TO:** Americas Head of Research
  
**ROLE TYPE:** Entry level
  
**DEPARTMENT:** Legal Benchmarking Group
  
**BRAND:** IP Stars & World Tax
  
**LOCATIONS:** NYC/Tri-State Area
  
  

Legal Benchmarking Group, a division of Delinian is hiring a Research Analyst.
  
We are looking for someone who will perform research and interviews for the legal and professional services markets in their assigned jurisdictions and practice areas, as well as represent the brand on brand-related events, awards, & conferences. The ideal candidate will analyze law firm submissions and interview leading practitioners, including corporate clients, to compile rankings, awards nominations and winners, and editorial content.
  
ABOUT THE COMPANY
  
Our Legal Benchmarking Group business serves professionals across the financial and professional services sector, covering markets such as legal and banking sectors. We are a highly diversified business with services that support clients' market intelligence, business development, and workflow solutions. Under the parent company known as Delinian, we have over 1,000 colleagues located mainly within three hubs (London, New York, Hong Kong) and customers in over 150 countries. Our research department publishes market-leading information online for in-house counsel, external practitioners and industry leaders in core practice areas including international tax, international financial law, intellectual property and life sciences, and litigation/arbitration.
  
  

**We pride ourselves on our P.A.C.E. culture:** proactive, agile, customer-focused, entrepreneurial, which enables knowledgeable professionals to do their best work. We also believe in autonomy, accountability,passion, and a sense of humor.
  
  

Delinian is a global B2B information-services portfolio business. Delinian’s brands provide actionable data, analysis, intelligence and access in markets where information and convening market participants are valued. Delinian has over 2,200 employees located in North America, South America, Europe and Asia. For more information on our parent company and our strategy, please visit: www.delinian.com
  
  

THE OPPORTUNITY
  
Our business is transforming as we seek to retain the relevance our brands have within the markets they serve, while also taking advantage of our scale to deliver better results for our customers. This means laser focus on responding to our client's needs for specialism, while also building common tools and functions that allow us to meet customer's needs better.
  
  

We are seeking an entry-levelResearch Analyst who will perform qualitative market research and conduct interviews for the legal and professional services markets in their assigned jurisdictions and practice areas. The ideal candidate will analyze law firm submissions and interview leading practitioners, including corporate clients, to compile accreditation firm and lawyer rankings, editorial content, thought leadership reports, and represent the brand at awards, events, and in other public-speaking capacities in support of the team’s timely delivery of high-quality research outputs.
  
  

PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES
  
  

**The Research Analyst is responsible for:**  

* Evaluating law firms' strengths, weaknesses, market positioning, and service offerings
* Conducting comprehensive market research, including legal trends and case studies,
* Analyzing and identifying key firms and players, market dynamics, and emerging opportunities to innovate
* Gathering and compiling quantitative and qualitative data into research accreditation ranking tables, star lists, editorial analysis, and awards deliverables
* Monitoring regional trends provide insights into market evolution
* Providing strategic recommendations based on research findings, supporting the development of business strategies and decision-making
* Providing insights into niche markets and emerging opportunities
* Utilizing various research methods, including surveys, interviews, and data analysis tools, to gather and interpret data.
* Representing the brand in meetings, awards, events, conferences, and other public-speaking opportunities.
* Contributing to the output of research findings and insights to clients in a clear and understandable manner
* Supporting Senior Research Analysts and Heads of Research in their preparation of detailed reports and presentations summarizing research findings, insights, and actionable recommendations and solutions
* When applicable, traveling to attend legal conferences to stay connected with industry professionals


THE TEAM
  
The Legal Benchmarking Group is passionate about our brands, our products, our customers, and the ability to retain them.
  
  

KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS
  
* High level research and writing skills
* Ability to work independently, keep deadlines, and multi-task
* Intellectual curiosity and a desire to learn about specialized legal sectors
* Strong organization, note-taking skills, and telephone/video manner
* Strong written and spoken English
* Comfortability with public-speaking


BENEFITS
  
* You will receive a competitive salary offering range of $49-50K as well as other benefits, including paid holidays, volunteer days, sick, floating and other discretionary gifted days.
* We offer flexible working arrangements (with attendance in the office a minimum of once a week) and place a strong emphasis on a good work/life balance
* Access to LinkedIn Learning resources for training and upskilling
* Corporate culture with active employee resource groups focused on women, race & ethnicity, LGBTQ+, disabilities, and wellbeing.


The annual salary range for this position is $49-50K. The actual compensation may vary based on work experience, education and skill levels. Our total compensation packages may also include competitive annual bonuses, commissions, or quarterly MBOs, dependent on the role. These will be discussed with you during the interview process. The salary range represents Delinian’s good faith belief of the current market-value for the role at the time of this posting and is provided in support of New York’s Salary Transparency initiative.
  
Delinian provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
  
  

We offer a competitive compensation package which empowers our employees to thrive both professionally and personally. Our benefits package includes medical, dental and vision coverage, employer matching retirement plan, flexible work arrangements, vacation time & paid holidays, tuition reimbursement & learning resources.
  
  

Legal Benchmarking Group provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Client Services Representative
description:
Bridge Dermpath is a physician-owned practice that specializes in the field of dermatopathology. Our state-of-the-art laboratory is located in Tarrytown, NY. This position is full-time with a work schedule of Monday-Friday, Day shift 8:00 AM 4:30 PM.

**Job Summary:**

Handle all inbound customer contacts received by telephone, electronically, in writing and in person. Troubleshoot inquiries. Follow-up with customers on issues that cannot be resolved immediately. Place outbound calls to clients in accordance with call log procedures and policies.

**Job Responsibilities:**

· Primarily responsible for verifying and entering accurate diagnostic data, may transcribe microscopic diagnosis and other clinical information into LIS

· Use of Dragon medical dictation software

· Make corrections/edits to diagnostic reports, as per Pathologist instructions

· Provide verbally, STAT and malignant results to clients, as applicable

· Obtain patient clinical history, as applicable

· May participate in training of new staff members

· Prepare outside consultations

· May select pathologist QC cases (PASR)

· May assign CPT codes

· Identify problems that may adversely affect test performance or reporting of test results and either correct problem or immediately notify general supervisor, technical supervisor or director

· Understand and follow all applicable standard operating procedures for job-related responsibilities, to include Pathologist Electronic Signature Guidelines SOP

· Handle all customer inquiries received by telephone, fax, or email regarding reporting of patient results, inquiries of tests and services, concerns of service failures and other duties to provide superior service

· Report laboratory results to clients using established protocols

· Document reporting or call history in required format and maintain complete and accurate records

· Contact the client to resolve routine matters related to patient testing and result reporting

· Report client concerns using established protocols

· Provides education and guidance to clients about Bridge Dermpath’s lab processes

· Understands the importance of Quality Service and how it is measured

· Escalates issues as appropriate using established protocols

· Leads by example in demonstrating “gold standards” behaviors

Perform other duties as assigned

title: Corporate Relations Manager
description:
**Title:** Corporate Relations Manager

**Location:** Jersey Cares is located in Livingston, NJ. Jersey Cares staff is operating on a hybrid work schedule with 3 days in the office, and 2 days working remotely. Candidates must be based in the New Jersey Metro area.

**Who We Are:** Jersey Cares is an inherent creator of change. As a leader in volunteerism, we address critical community-identified needs, and work every day to make the world a better place. Our team is small but mighty. Each team member brings a unique and diversified perspective to our work, but one thing we all have in common is our passion to create a lasting impact on the lives of those we serve.

**Position Description:**

Jersey Cares is seeking a creative, driven, Corporate Relations Manager that is ready to impact their world at a pivotal time of innovation within the organization. The Corporate Relations Manager must be enthusiastic about being a part of a passionate team of nonprofit professionals that help companies increase their Corporate Social Responsibility programs through customized virtual and in-person volunteer service projects.

The ideal candidate has event planning or project management experience. This individual will address the needs of the community by creating, planning, staffing, and managing corporate partner projects and upholding the high standards of the Jersey Cares’ Corporate Service Program.

**Responsibilities:**

* Project Management
* Design and lead days of service for small and large groups of corporate volunteers.
* Manage logistics for multiple days of service that run concurrently including all aspects of project preparation, both administrative and physical.
* Manage vendor relationships to identify and procure project supplies.
* Manage multiple project budgets concurrently.
* Develop new projects and workshops to actively engage volunteers.
* Instill a sense of enthusiasm among volunteers.
* Strategic Partnerships
* Identify, foster, and maintain strategic partnerships with community partners throughout New Jersey.
* Manage multiple corporate partner accounts simultaneously.
* Proactively identify potential challenges and determine creative solutions.
* Management of the customer relations management (CRM) system, Salesforce.
* Communications
* Create interactive and engaging social media content and communications collateral for organizational and departmental initiatives

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s Degree.
* Nonprofit or CSR experience preferred.
* Knowledge of grant management systems and sponsorship tracking is a plus.
* Strong project management skills.
* Experience working with a high-performance, collaborative, constructive team.
* Ability to handle a variety of constituencies, manage multiple tasks simultaneously, and thrive in a complex environment with multiple priorities.
* Personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and a commitment to and passion for Jersey Cares mission and that of its nonprofit partners.
* Exemplary oral and written communication skills.
* Ability to work flexible hours.
* Access to a vehicle.
* Ability to lift and carry 50 pounds.
* Ability to stand for long periods of time.
* Experience with customer relations management (CRM) system, Salesforce; Classy; and Constant Contact preferred.

**Compensation:** 

* Annual salary is $45,000
* Health insurance (vision, dental, medical)
* 401(k) benefits
* 15 vacation days
* 9 sick days
* Flexible Fridays
* Office closed for winter holiday (1+ weeks)
* Flexible/hybrid work schedule
* Team wellness initiatives
* Mileage reimbursement

**To Apply:**

* Please submit a resume and cover letter stating why this opportunity is right for you based on your experience to Kristen Coppola at kristenc@jerseycares.org.
* A resume without a cover letter will not be reviewed or considered.
* Please no calls.

If you are seeking to be a part of a family, this is the place for you!

Our facilities are capable of receiving, storing, processing and dispatching cargo, so we can build flexibility and resilience into the supply chain process. Our integrated solutions allow us to be prepared for supply chain risks, so we can plan distribution to better achieve lead time and goals despite unexpected conditions. title: Foster Care Case Planner (Queens and Brooklyn Vacancies)
description:
*SCO Family of Services has provided vital human services throughout New York City and Long Island for more than 100 years. SCO helps vulnerable New Yorkers build a strong foundation for the future. We get young children off to a good start, launch youth into adulthood, stabilize and strengthen families and unlock potential for children and adults with special needs.*

*SCO Family of Services welcomes you to join our family and help us work together to carry out our mission to build a stronger tomorrow.*

**JOB TITLE: Case Planner**

**DEPARTMENT: Enhanced Family Foster Care**

**FUNCTION OF THE POSITION:** The Case Planner is responsible for working with the family to support safety, permanency, and well-being to all children and youth. The Case Planner works with the family to develop and support implementation of the service plan, address barriers, assess progress, and identify changes as needed to achieve the goals.

**REPORTS TO:** Case Planning Supervisor

**SUPERVISES:** N/A

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

· Complete initial face-to-face contact with the child in the foster home within 2 business days.

· Adhering to SCO casework contact policies, the Case Planner will conduct ongoing face-to-face contacts with the child, parent, and foster parent on caseload assessing for safety and risk.

· Complete Foster Home Safety Checklists, Birth Parent Safety Checklists, Safety and Abuse Risk Questionnaires, and Clothing Checklists during casework contacts on a monthly basis.

· Count and monitor medication and medication compliance.

· Complete ongoing documentation in Connections with 7 business days of the event date.

· Assess safety and risk as well as protective and promotive factors and collaborate with families to create safety plans.

· Work in partnership with the child/family to continuously identify their strengths, resources, and supports needed and engage families to actively participate in the development and assessment of their service plan.

· Make referrals for services for children and families, both internally and externally (i.e Health Homes Care Management, CFTSS, Preventive, and therapy).

· Work side-by-side with the foster parent and birthparent to support and provide treatment and crisis intervention to the child in their care.

· Collaborate with parent advocates and case aides to encourage and support parents in taking steps to address personal and/or family challenges so that their children and safely return home.

· Accompanying and supporting children and parents through various appointments including school, medical, and drug treatment, etc.

· Support families through the Public Assistance process, PATH process, and provide referrals, as needed.

· Engage parents and foster families in concurrent planning from the beginning of the case, and work with foster parents toward adoption or KinGAP as appropriate based on each child’s permanency goal.

· Attends all required trainings including Core Case Planning and TRIPP. Case Planners should be aware of any significant changes in the field and be willing to attend outside trainings, seminars, and workshops, as needed for professional development.

· Complete timely comprehensive Permanency Hearing reports and FASP’s regarding the status of the family’s action plan and progress towards permanency.

· Complete Interstate Compact for the Placement of Children (ICPC), emergency homestudies, and Termination of Parental Rights packets, as needed.

· Intervene in crisis situations to help the child and family stabilize.

· Reinforce foster parent trainings.

· Attend and testify in court appearances.

· Support and supervise family time between parents and children, as well as siblings and other significant resources. Provide transportation as needed.

· Within 30 days of placement, complete initial treatment plan.

· Attend all interdisciplinary team meetings and actively provide information regarding services being provided to the child.

· Fulfills duty of Mandated Reporter, which entails reporting any suspected instances of child abuse or maltreatment.

· Meet with Supervisor one-on-one on a consistent basis to discuss safety and permanency issues of caseload.

· Communicates and work effectively with SCO foster care support staff such as Case Planners, Fair Future Coaches, Education Specialists, Parent Advocates, Case Aides, and medical and mental health staff and with NYC Children’s Services, outside medical and mental health centers, schools, consultants, other SCO programs, and all other relevant parties.

· Adheres to SCO’s personnel policies.

· Performs other duties as assigned.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

· Bachelor’s degree required, BSW or MSW preferred.

· Approved background clearances and fingerprinting are required.

· Excellent oral and written communication.

· Proficiency in computer skills, including Microsoft Office, Excel and Connections.

· **Bilingual abilities are strongly encouraged.**

**· Valid NYS Driver License required**

**In addition, all EFFC employees should possess the following characteristics:**

· Be team players. Maintain a constructive, cooperative, and positive atmosphere.

· Demonstrate commitment to the Agency’s mission and values.

· Be able to empathize and provide quality services to children and families that have histories of chemical dependency, mental illness, neglect, physical, sexual and/or emotional abuse.

· Be willing to work closely with children, families, and staff from different cultural and religious backgrounds, as well as from varying socio-economic statuses.

· Work competently, compassionately and without judgment with individuals who may identify as lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and/or may be in different stages of discovering or disclosing their sexual orientation or gender identity.

· Possess a strong belief in people’s ability to grow and change; forge a mutually respectful partnership with persons served and their families.

· Be flexible in their ability to work extended hours or irregular schedules in response to the program’s needs. Be willing to travel between the various EFFC offices and other agency sites, as required.

· Demonstrate an ability to set limits and maintain the helping role of practitioner, as well as to intervene appropriately.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $30.22 per hour

Benefits:

* 403(b)
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Patent Agent
description:
At Haley Guiliano, our team sets us apart. We continuously look for talented individuals to join us and are actively recruiting for the following opportunities:

**PATENT AGENT - NEW YORK**

* Title: Patent Agent (Organic Chemistry)
* Location: New York NY, (Financial District)
* Travel: As needed / Typically <10%
* Job Type: Full-time

Haley Guiliano LLP (HG) is a fast-growing full-service IP law firm with offices in New York City, San Jose and London. At HG, we specialize in building patent portfolios that impact and drive our client’s business. Our clients, who come to us from a vast array of engineering and life sciences sectors, have come to rely on HG’s technical know-how and understanding to support their success.

HG is actively seeking talented chemists for our New York office to work on patent-related matters as Patent Agents.

Applicants should have the ability to commute to our NY office.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Counsel clients on strategies for how to protect their inventions.
* Prepare and prosecute patent applications.
* Defend client patents against third party challenges.
* Help clients when third parties have misappropriated client intellectual property.
* Confer with inventors about their inventions.

**Job Qualifications**

* Ph.D. degree in Chemistry, preferably in Organic Chemistry.
* 3-5 years prior patent drafting and prosecution experience.
* Admitted to practice before the USPTO.
* Exceptional English written and oral communication skills.
* Must have a healthy curiosity and an interest in developing a career in intellectual property.
* Excellent analytical skills and a robust problem-solving mindset.
* A strong drive and willingness to own projects and see them to completion.
* Multi-dimensional interest in and capable of rapidly learning new technologies.
* Excellent academic record.
* Practical research experience.

**Benefits**

We offer a collegial and casual work environment.

Benefits include:

· Medical, Dental, Vision

· Life insurance

· Unlimited PTO

· Law school tuition

Salary range is $130K-$150K based on experience.

For eligible Patent Agents, we will fund law school costs and expenses for an approved, part-time evening law school program.

**To Apply:**

Please apply with an email to LifeSciencesRecruiting@hglaw.com. To move forward with an application, we’ll need the following:

* Resume
* Transcripts (unofficial is acceptable)
* Writing sample (pick something that you think shows off your ability to communicate)

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10004

title: Laboratory Aide
description:
Bridge Dermpath is a physician-owned practice that specializes in the field of dermatopathology. Our state-of-the-art laboratory is located in Tarrytown, NY. This position is full-time with a work schedule of Monday-Friday from 7:00 PM until 3:30 AM.

**Job Responsibilities:**

· Completes lab QC logs in a timely manner

· Records all information accurately, neatly, and legibly on appropriate forms

· Ensures staining solution levels are within the established range

· Changes/rotates staining solutions and rotates reagents/supplies according to dates received and/or expiration dates

· Assembles slides according to case number in slide tray with corresponding requisition slip

· Distributes glass slides to pathologists

· Handles and disposes chemical wastes with appropriate PPE

· Performs routine cleaning and maintenance of lab technician stations, slide stainer, & coverslippers

· Ensures that surfaces of tissue processors are free of paraffin after removing baskets at the end of tissue processing

· Cleans exterior of laboratory equipment and work areas using appropriate cleaning solutions

· Pulls specimen(s) from specimen storage room as asked by pathologist or technical staff

· Pulls specimens from storage shelves in preparation for tissue discard

· Ensures specimens are appropriately filed in storage room

· Receives and delivers shipments to their respective areas

· Conducts routine inventory and item rotation; maintains all inventory in POS

· Keeps storage areas free of clutters

· Immediate notification of existing and/or potential problems to the proper authority

· Perform other related duties as assigned

**Job Requirements:**

**Education:**

High School Diploma or equivalent required

Bachelor of Science/Art Degree preferred

**Work Experience/Physical Requirements:**

· 1+ years of Laboratory experience

· Must be able to manage multiple tasks at once

· Proven ability to work in a fast-paced work environment while maintaining the highest levels of accuracy

· Must have excellent verbal, writing, and reading comprehension of English language

· Must have excellent attention to detail

· Ability to lift 50+ lbs

· Ability to stand and walk for prolonged periods of time

· Ability to properly handle various hazardous chemicals

Bridge Dermpath provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $22.00 - $25.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Night shift

Work Location: In person

title: Cashier/Customer Service

title: Healthcare Advocate
company: Center for the Independence of the Disabled, New York
description:
CENTER FOR INDEPENDENCE OF THE DISABLED IN NEW YORK

**POSITION: HEALTH CARE ADVOCATE**

**SALARY: $65,000**

The Center for Independence of the Disabled in New York (CIDNY) is the leading organization serving and representing people with disabilities in New York City. CIDNY's mission is the removal of barriers to full integration of people with disabilities. CIDNY helps people with disabilities to gain the skills and obtain the services they need to live independently in the community. CIDNY advocates for fair and effective policies that improve the quality of life for people with disabilities. CIDNY is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

**Position: Health Care Advocate**

**General Description:**

The Advocate will assist seniors and people with disabilities as they transition into and navigate Managed Long-Term Care (MLTC) and Fully Integrated Duals Advantage (FIDA) plans.

**Reports to:** Director of Consumer Services

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Provide direct in person consumer assistance, advocacy, and education for MLTC, FIDA participants/caregivers by explaining enrollment and disenrollment, benefits, coverage and access rules and procedures, member rights and responsibilities, and appeals. Information will also be provided through distribution of written material.
* Assist participants/caregivers with raising and resolving quality of care and quality of life issues. Train other community-based organizations advocates on these and other issues, and prepare do it yourself template materials for participants/caregivers to use.
* Assist participants/caregivers with accessing records from the Managed Long-term Care/Fully Integrated Dual Advantage plan(s);
* Explain the grievance and appeal process and assist participants/caregivers in resolving problems and issues using skilled negotiation techniques and providing assistance in filing grievances and appeals when informal problem resolution proves unsuccessful.
* Provide consumer outreach and education presentations at other community-based organizations and to participants/caregivers and advocates. Assist with developing and maintaining an outreach and education campaign that will include written materials, audio, posters, ads, presentations, videos, and paid advertising.
* Collaborate in the development of an accessible, interactive web-site to allow consumers to send electronic requests for information, advice, referrals, and direct assistance, and program materials. Assist with developing materials, include advocate training, consumer presentation templates, facts sheets for consumer, web-based materials, and the Advocates Guide, and continually review these materials.
* Comply with all requirements established by NY State Department of Health for obtaining consent, ensuring access to records, coordinating contacts with plans, coordinating referrals, and for ensuring confidentiality, and protect against inappropriate disclosures of identifying information.
* Ensures all significant client data and service provision details are current and accurate, and that they are documented in a timely manner into CIDNY’s and the contracted provider’s databases.
* Assist in the impartial bidding process to identify up to 10 community-based organization to serve other regions of the state, review submissions according to objective criteria provided, and assist with final decisions.
* Maintain quality assurance procedures established. Conduct quality assurance reviews of cases, using case notes and information reports in the database, of five to ten percent of randomly selected cases.
* Attends Agency's in-service training and unit meetings as well as any other agency-related activities. Conduct trainings regarding client education, navigational and appeal services, consumer rights and responsibilities.
* Identify systemic trends or practices that affect people with disabilities and seniors and work closely with other stakeholders to design a systematic response. Assist in preparation of reports concerning the program. Research as required.

**Qualifications**

**Education and/or experience required:**

* Bachelor’s Degree with 5 or more years in a similar position required
* Attorney or Paralegal, or Master’s Degree with 3 or more years in a similar position in the health care advocacy field preferred
* Proven experience working with people who need health care navigation assistance, previous work with the disability community a plus.
* Personal experience with disability a plus.

**Skills, Licenses, and/or competencies required:**

* Knowledge of health care coverage information, eligibility rules, and resources information.
* Excellent interpersonal skills, knowledge of social service delivery systems, knowledge of government/benefits resources, good organizational, and communication skills;
* Strong advocacy skills and effective communication skills required.
* Individual must have time management skills to maintain individual/community outreaches, caseload, documentation and administrative requirements;
* In addition, the ability to work well independently as well as part of a team;
* Must be computer literate of basic Microsoft Programs;
* Research skills and knowledge of Medicare and Medicaid law and policy desired. Knowledge of the Americans with Disabilities Act preferred.
* Bilingual skills a plus.
* Respectful and comfortable with people from different cultural and socio-economic backgrounds.
* Competence in languages other than English preferred.

**Position Specifics:**

· Location: CIDNY's Manhattan Office: 1010 Avenue of the Americas, Suite 301, New York, NY, 10018.

· Salary: $65,000 annually.

· Shift: 9:00 am till 5:00 pm.

· Monday – Friday.

· Hybrid Schedule.

· Supervises three (3) other positions.

· Benefits available: Medical, paid time off, Sick pay, Paid holidays, Dental, Life insurance, Vision, and 403B plan.

CIDNY conforms to all laws, statutes, and regulations concerning equal employment opportunities and affirmative action. We strongly encourage women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans to apply to all our job openings. We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, genetic information and testing, family and medical leave, sexual orientation and gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We prohibit retaliation against individuals who bring forth any complaint, orally or in writing, to the employer or the government or against any individuals who assist or participate in the investigation of any complaint or otherwise oppose discrimination.

**MUST PROVIDE PROOF OF COVID-19 VACCINATION AND BOOSTER.**

**How to Apply:**

Please send a thoughtful cover letter and resume to Massiel Felix, Director of Consumer Services. Please use the job title as the email header. The cover letter should include your work history and other relevant life experience, and it should clarify what transferable skills you bring to the posted job description. **No application will be considered without this cover letter.** Do not send by fax.

**Please use the job title as the email header. NO PHONE CALLS, PLEASE.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 per year

* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

* JD (Required)

title: Driver; 1135-501-H
description:
For over 125 years, Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens has been providing quality social services to the neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens and currently offers 160-plus programs and services for children, youth, adults, seniors, and those struggling with mental illness.
  
Older Adult Centers promote an active life for seniors. The centers aim to assist them to preserve their independence and health by offering various range of activities and services such as serving breakfast, lunch, health screenings, social services, educational workshops, class exercises, discussion groups, games, art classes, lectures, workshops, organized outings, and special events.
  
STATEMENT OF THE JOB
  
The Driver will be required to transport older adult clients on regularly scheduled routes to various destinations. Escort and assist infirm clients from their homes to the vehicle and back. Perform clerical functions including data entry, filing, answering phones and distributing mail.
  
* Transport clients on regularly scheduled routes from their homes to destinations such as senior centers, supermarkets, shopping malls, medical appointments as determined by the Director or other assigned staff.
* Escort and assist the fragile clients from their homes to the vehicle and back, if necessary.
* Ensure the safety of the passengers through the use of seat belts, wheelchair brackets and other safety devices.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* High School Diploma or GED preferred.
* Valid New York State Driver’s License (Class D) and provision of printout of annual Driving Record from Motor Vehicle Bureau.
* Must obtain defensive driving certificate within 6 months of employment.
* One (1) year driving experience with no more than one moving violation within a 24-month period, no driving while intoxicated convictions.
* Knowledge of roadways in the area where program operates.
* Ability to lift to 25lbs.


**BENEFITS:**  

We offer competitive salary.
  
For more information on our organization, please visit our website at:
  
www.ccbq.org EOE/AA.

title: Custodian; 5432-705-N
description:
For over 125 years, Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens has been providing quality social services to the neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens, and currently offers 160-plus programs and services for children, youth, adults, seniors, and those struggling with mental illness.
  
Our Early Childhood Development Centers provide free Early Head Start and Head Start services to low-income families. Head Start provides services to children age 3 to 5 years old. Through the Montessori approach, the center ensures children are ready for school by providing a variety of developmentally appropriate activities that promote cognitive, social, emotional, language-literacy and physical development.
  
  

**STATEMENT OF THE JOB:**  

Under the supervision of the Program Manager the Custodian will be required to ensure the center is maintained in a clean, sanitary condition for the benefit of those attending the program and in compliance with health and safety rules and regulations.
  
* Sweeps, mops, and waxes floors of classrooms, offices, halls, kitchen and bathrooms of center so they are kept in a clean and sanitary condition.
* Conducts monthly cleanings of range hood, if any, and its parts as required by the City
* Division of Fire Prevention.
* Records supplies and equipment; Informs Program Manager/Educational Director of needed sanitary and cleaning supplies and repairs and replacements of cleaning equipment.
* Assists with food service as needed.
* Performs other duties as assigned.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* High School Diploma required.
* 2 years of experience in general custodial duties, such as cleaning, repairing, and painting preferred.
* Bilingual Spanish/English; Russian/English; Chinese/English; Korean/English; English/Creole speaking preferred.
* Ability to lift, carry, push, and/or pull light to moderate amounts of weight 50 pounds including the occasional moving of furniture and setting up and replacing chairs, etc.
* Able to travel to multiple locations within the five boroughs as needed.


**BENEFITS:****We offer competitive salary and excellent benefits including:**  

* Generous time off (Vacation/ Personal Days/ Sick Days/ Paid Holidays annually)
* Medical,
* Dental
* Vision
* Retirement Savings with Agency Match

For more information on our organization, please visit our website at:
  
www.ccbq.org EOE/AA.

title: Child Development Specialist; 5459-204-N
description:
For over 125 years, Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens has been providing quality social services to the neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens, and currently offers 160-plus programs and services for children, youth, adults, seniors, and those struggling with mental illness.
  
  

Our Early Childhood Development Centers provide free Early Head Start and Head Start services to low-income families. Early Head Start provides services to children six weeks to age 3. Through the Montessori approach, the center ensures children are ready for school by providing a variety of developmentally appropriate activities that promote cognitive, social, emotional, language-literacy and physical development.
  
  

**STATEMENT OF THE JOB:**  

The Early Head Start Child Development Specialist (CDS) is responsible for providing professional expertise in Early Childhood Education and Development for our Early Childhood Development Centers Early Head Start program option. Monitoring and educational support to providers regarding Assessment, Screenings, and manage data in the TSG. The CDS will periodically verify compliance with agency policy; facilitate ongoing communication between program staff, and enrolled families. The CDS will provide recommendations for technical assistance in developing relationships with other childcare professionals." The CDS will monitor the consultation, training, policy and procedure development, agency collaboration and tracking of Childhood Education/Childhood Development services.
  
* Collaborates with CCNS other Early Head Start and pre-K programs to develop transition plans, monitor services.
* Supports the Early Head Start staff concerning issues of classroom environments, teaching skills, curriculum support and transitioning of children and their families. This includes, but is not limited to phone, e-mail, written reports, record keeping and tracking of data.
* Researches information in the areas of Child Development from professional journals, magazines, reports, and community organizations and disseminating to staff, and parents.
* Provides support in the coordination of the annual Program Self-Assessment and the follow-up reporting.
* Provides input with developing and maintaining written policies and procedures that are in compliance with the Early Head Start Performance Standards.
* Performs other duties as assigned.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Minimum of Bachelor's degree in Early Childhood Education or Early Childhood Development, Early Intervention or related degree (with minimum of 6 classes with primary focus on ECE/ECD).
* At least one year related experience with age groups 0-3, through employment, practicum, student teaching, or volunteering in a pre-school educational environment.
* Bilingual Spanish/English; Russian/English; Chinese/English; Korean/English; English/Creole speaking preferred.
* Ability to lift 25 lbs.
* Able to travel to multiple locations within the five boroughs as needed.


**BENEFITS:****We offer competitive salary and excellent benefits including:**  

* Generous time off (Vacation/ Personal Days/ Sick Days/ Paid Holidays annually)
* Medical,
* Dental

title: Vocational Rehabilitation Counselor
company: Center for the Independence of the Disabled, New York
description:
**Vocational Rehabilitation Counselor, Full Time**

**Salary:** $53,000-55,000

Center for Independence of the Disabled, New York (CIDNY) is the leading organization serving and representing people with disabilities in New York City. Our goal is to ensure full integration, independence, and equal opportunity for all people with disabilities by removing barriers to the social, economic, cultural, and civic life of the community.

**Job Description**

The Vocational Rehabilitation Counselor (VRC) is responsible for working with adults and youth with disabilities. These activities may consist of working with people with disabilities with educating high school students, young adults, and adults with disabilities about their employment rights, aiding their transition from high school to adult life, including but is not limited to competitive, supportive, or customized work activities, volunteer activities, benefits advisement, reasonable accommodations, vocational or trade schools, and higher education. This position reports to the Director of Employment and Vocational Rehabilitation Services.

**The primary duties include:**

* Empowering and supporting youth and adults with disabilities as they make transitions to vocational trades, higher education, employment, and adult life.
* Developing and implementing workshops designed to help youth and adults with disabilities learn more about vocational trades, higher education, employment, self-confidence, and their rights as persons with disabilities.
* Helping youth and adults with disabilities develop goals and action plans for outcomes.
* Supporting youth and adults with disabilities to identify and address barriers to their vocational goals.
* Supporting youth and adults with disabilities with the cultivation of community connections will further lead to employment, vocational trades or higher education activities and address barriers to their desired goals.
* Attending agency’s in-service training and unit meetings as well as other agency-related activities.
* Identifying and outreaching to organizations/agencies/schools/parent groups that focus on youth and adults with disabilities to create community linkages.
* Developing work plans to ensure that contract deliverables are met and that schedules for workshops, training, and meetings are maintained.
* Complete 1500 hours of program contact hours per calendar year for all contact deliverables.
* Input all statistical data daily into CIDNY’s Cilsfirst database.
* Travel to all outreach events prescribed by the Program Director.
* Complete all contract reports accurately and timely.
* Performing other tasks as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

* Master’s degree preferred Preferably in Vocational Rehabilitation Counseling, Social Services or Psychology.
* (Certification for Rehabilitation Counseling (CRC) preferred.
* Bachelor’s degree required Preferably in Social Services/Psychology.
* Bilingual language proficiency required (Spanish).
* Proven experience working with youth and adults with disabilities
* Ability to work independently
* Experience with public speaking and presenting workshops/trainings
* Ability to interact professionally with consumers and colleagues
* Respectful and comfortable with persons from different cultural and socio-economic backgrounds
* Background in and/or understanding of disability-related issues
* Background in and/or understanding of mental health related issues
