title: Chef Instructor
description:
*CocuSocial is one of the premiere culinary experience providers in the US. As a minority founded and owned company, we celebrate diversity and inclusivity of all backgrounds. Our team of Chef Instructors based in 17 different cities across the U.S. and the variety of different cooking classes and experiences offered through our platform reflect our philosophy that through food, we can come together and connect with one another - regardless of differences in culture, ethnicity, religion, or sexual orientation.*

*We are seeking experienced chef instructors to teach live,* ***in-person*** *recreational cooking, pastry, mixology, and wine tasting classes.* *This opportunity is* ***not virtual****. This opportunity is available for chefs who have access to a venue (such as their own home, a restaurant, commercial kitchen, or event space) or who are interested in teaching in one of CocuSocial's partner venues (restaurants, hotels, breweries, event spaces). The location where you intend to host your classes must be located on Long Island or within 40 minutes driving distance of the city.*

*CocuSocial Chef Instructors can expect flexible scheduling, the opportunity to teach recipes and dishes they're passionate about, a supportive team to assist in creating best-selling classes, and compensation based on the number of guests in attendance.*

*We're looking for experienced chef instructors who are comfortable teaching any of the following popular international dishes: Dumplings, Pad Thai, Ramen, Pizza, Handmade Pasta, Croissants, Chocolate Truffles, French Macarons, Choux Pastry, Donuts, Spanish Paella and Spanish Tapas. We also welcome mixologists and sommeliers to teach classes as well!*

*The instructor will be responsible for leading and organizing the entire class, including purchasing ingredients, setting up (according to social distancing guidelines), teaching each dish step-by-step in a hands-on manner, and cleaning up.*

*Ideal candidate should be:*

*-An experienced chef instructor with at least 2 years experience teaching recreational cooking classes*

*-Someone who loves to share his/her/their passion for cooking with other people and help them to learn*

*\\*\\*\\*If interested in teaching in your own space, the venue/home should be able to accommodate at least 4 people (indoor and/or outdoor)*

*Please refer to our existing in-person and online classes on the website: https://cocusocial.com/.*

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $200.00 - $350.00 per day

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Supplemental Pay:

* Tips

Application Question(s):

* Please share the class topics or cuisines you would be most comfortable teaching in a hands-on class.
* Are you interested in teaching in your own home or venue, and/or one provided by CocuSocial?
* If in your own home or venue, how many individuals are you able to accommodate in a given class?

Experience:

* teaching recreational cooking class: 2 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* ServSafe (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Analyst, Associate Development Program
description:
Purpose and Job Summary
Lument is currently seeking to hire Analysts for its Associate Development Program (“ADP”) at its Columbus, Ohio and New York City offices.
The Associate Development Program (ADP) is a best-in-class program that develops entry-level analyst and associate talent. Participants in the ADP will undergo a comprehensive internal training program in commercial real estate, credit analysis, and Lument products, with exposure to the multifamily, affordable, and seniors housing sectors.
The diverse deal exposure provides an opportunity for participants to explore career paths over a 12-month period that best suits their strengths and interests before making a permanent career decision. Upon completion of this initial training, ADP participants will work closely with these areas of the business on various aspects of production, credit, and asset management support before direct placement in one of these groups.
The 12-month program is tailored towards recent undergraduate candidates, with recruiting focused from August to December. Individuals who are currently working with 1-3 years of experience are also eligible for consideration. As a growing firm with expanding services, there is excellent potential for professional development and promotion within the company.
Participants in the Associate Development Program will be required to reside in New York or Columbus, Ohio and be based in those offices for the 12-month duration of the program from July 2025-July 2026. The geographic location of permanent roles will vary dependent upon sector and line of business.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities* Perform comprehensive financial analysis for transactions.
* Creation of credit profiles, mortgage insurance applications, and corresponding exhibits, offering memoranda, management, and board presentations, pitch books, and other material relevant to originating and executing leveraged finance, private financings, M&A, and financial advisory transactions.
* Participation in all stages of deals from engagement to closing, including day-to-day interactions with internal team and staff, clients, agencies, investors, and other funding participants.
* Provide support to loan originators and underwriters as necessary to help facilitate the due diligence process.
* Develop and apply basic knowledge of Lument programs, requirements, policies and procedures, and other mortgage and finance programs offered by Lument.
* Involvement in corporate and strategic initiatives as the need arises.
* Work professionally and harmoniously with team and coworkers.
* Committed to upholding and emulating the ORIX USA core values, which are: Pursue Excellence, Seize Opportunity, Live Honorably, Create Value, and Thrive Together.
* Other projects and duties as assigned.


Contacts
This position has frequent contact with all levels of employees and management. In addition, this role may interact with outside business partners, vendors, consultants, and other office visitors.
Education, Skills & Experience* Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, accounting, real estate, or a related field required.
* Formal education, internship, or work experience in commercial real estate or sectors served by the firm preferred.
* Willingness to relocate required.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (with emphasis on Microsoft Excel).
* Excellent organizational, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to plan, organize, and prioritize assignments, and meet critical and established deadlines; Ability to manage multiple assignments and transactions simultaneously.
* Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality and to use discretion in the performance of daily activities.
* Exceptional communicator with a professional business image and command of the English language, both verbally and in writing (spelling, grammar, and punctuation).
* Ability to learn quickly and demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a high- performance team.
* Flexibility and ability to work under pressure with tight deadlines and constant interruptions; Ability to adjust priorities in a changing environment.

*Annual base salary gross: $70,000 - $90,000* *(NY only)**. The base salary range represents the estimated low and high end of the Lument's salary for this position. Actual base salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and proficiency for the role. The base pay is one component of* *Lument**’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards and benefits include cash bonuses, long term incentives, health insurance, accident and life insurance, and retirement benefits. Please visit our Benefits page for additional information.*  

Life at ORIX
We are committed to the health and well-being of our employees and offer a quality, competitive benefits package that provides valuable healthcare and financial protection for our workforce, while emphasizing a healthy work/life balance.  

You Time  

We want you to have the time needed to recharge and manage life with our competitive vacation policy, floating personal holidays, extensive leave options, our annual observed holidays, and more.  

Family Care  

Every family has a different journey and ORIX USA Group is proud to offer extensive benefit programs such as: infertility coverage, adoption support, child and elder care, fully paid maternity, and generous parental leave benefits to help you and your families along the way.  

Flexible Work Arrangements  

ORIX associates enjoy the advantages of our hybrid working model with a 3 day in-office minimum requirement.
ORIX USA is an equal opportunity employer, providing equal employment opportunities (EEO), and is committed to diversifying its workforce. All employees and applicants for employment will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, protected veteran status or other status protected by law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.

title: Event Staff
description:
**About Us**

Creative Games Inc. is a leading and cutting-edge event company in the New York area that caters to upscale events, ranging from Bar/Bat Mitzvahs, weddings, corporate parties, and more. We host events mainly on Long Island and in New York City, but also in NJ, CT, PA, and MA.

Our office & warehouse location is in Hicksville, NY, so adequate transportation to and from is required. Our events are mostly on weekends, though some are during the week. And the events you would be working often require travel, late nights, long hours on your feet, and lifting heavy equipment.

**The Job**

Creative Games Inc. is currently seeking outgoing, high-energy, and collaborative individuals to join our Event Staff. Our team is responsible for loading in, setting up, operating, breaking down, and loading out equipment.

They are ALSO responsible for greeting and engaging with guests, oftentimes children, encouraging them to participate in games, photo booths, custom shops, and other forms of entertainment. Staff members typically rotate event stations and work equipment that best align with their skill sets.

Black formal dress attire is required during events.

Applicants must possess excellent time management skills, be capable of lifting objects at least 50lbs., and be willing to work a variety of tasks.

**Basic Requirements**

* Must be comfortable and appropriate around large groups of people, especially children
* Must remain calm in loud, high-energy, and fast-paced environments
* Must be friendly and engaging with guests, staying patient and having fun
* Must be professional and organized, a real team-player
* Must have the ability to walk long distances and stand for long periods of time

Previous event experience is beneficial, but not required. If you have a passion for sports, games, entertainment, and parties, you're a great match.

This is an excellent position for college students, recent grads, and anyone interested in weekend work.

\\*\\*Box truck driving capabilities a huge plus!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $18.00 - $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* 12 hour shift
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: On the road

title: Accounts Director for Scenic Fabrication
description:
The Factory NYC is a leading custom fabrication company specializing in innovative solutions for a variety of industries, including events, retail, art, architecture, and other related industries. We pride ourselves on our dedication to quality, craftsmanship, and customer satisfaction. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a dynamic and experienced Accounts Director to join our team and help us cultivate strong relationships with our clients and identify new revenue streams.

**Position Overview:**

The Accounts Director will lead our sales initiatives while managing and nurturing client accounts. This role requires a results-oriented professional with a robust sales background who can effectively utilize and mentor the sales team to connect with clients, identify their needs, and offer customized solutions that drive successful projects. The ideal candidate will possess a strategic mindset, exceptional communication skills, and a passion for exceeding sales targets while fostering a collaborative team environment.

**Position Responsibilities include:**

* Maintain a consistent sales stream to keep the company at full production capacity.
* Ensure the entire sales team is fostering relationships with new and existing clients, gauging and developing proposals to address their needs.
* Develop and implement sales tools and techniques to encourage revenue.
* Maintain accurate and profitable pricing on all bids.
* Identify new business opportunities such as new markets, clients, partnerships, or products and services.
* Analyze market trends and create strategies with the General Manager to increase opportunities.
* Personnel management of the Accounts team, including talent acquisition, interviewing, onboarding, and training.
* Distribution of requested bids to Account Managers and oversight of the department’s bandwidth.
* Working with Account Managers to meet their established sales goals.
* Supervise relationships between clients and Account Managers.
* Assure proposals developed by the Accounts team are on time and accurate.
* Development and implementation of sales-based SOPs, and monitoring their execution.
* Ascertain that project handoffs to the production department are successful.
* Work with adjacent Directors on company development and processes.

**Position Requirements:** 

* Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or Engineering (or related field).
* A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in a sales and accounts management role within a fabrication environment, with at least 1-2 years in a leading role.
* Proven track record of consistently achieving or exceeding sales targets and driving revenue growth.
* Strong negotiation, persuasion, and closing skills, with the ability to influence decision-makers effectively.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, adept at building trust and rapport with clients at all levels.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think strategically and make data-driven decisions.
* Familiarity with CRM systems and sales performance tracking tools.
* Willingness to travel as required to meet clients.

**What We Offer:** 

* Competitive salary with attractive commission. Total ranges from $160k to $180k or more per year.
* Comprehensive benefits package, including health, dental, and vision.
* Savings incentive match plan.
* Paid time off.
* Opportunities for professional development and ongoing training in sales techniques.
* A supportive, collaborative work environment that values innovation and teamwork.

**How to Apply:** 

This full-time position is available immediately and benefits are eligible after a short trial period including healthcare and paid time off. If you are a sales-driven professional looking to make a significant impact in a thriving company, we invite you to apply. Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and sales achievements.

The Factory NYC is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $160,000.00 - $180,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Account Management: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: RN Clinic/Ambulatory
description:
**Job Description:**

We are seeking a skilled and compassionate Registered Nurse (RN) to join our Clinic Ambulatory team. As an RN in our ambulatory clinic, you will be responsible for providing high-quality patient care in a fast-paced outpatient setting. Your duties will include assessing patient needs, administering medications, assisting with procedures, educating patients and families, and collaborating with other healthcare professionals to ensure coordinated and effective care delivery.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct comprehensive patient assessments and develop individualized care plans.
* Administer medications and treatments as prescribed by physicians.
* Assist healthcare providers during clinic procedures and examinations.
* Educate patients and families about their medical conditions, treatment plans, and self-care techniques.
* Provide emotional support and counseling to patients and families as needed.
* Document patient information accurately and timely in electronic medical records.
* Collaborate with interdisciplinary team members to coordinate patient care and services.
* Maintain a safe and clean environment for patients and staff.
* Adhere to all regulatory standards, policies, and procedures governing healthcare practices.

**Qualifications:**

* Current licensure as a Registered Nurse (RN) in the state of NY.
* Minimum 2+ year of experience as RN
* BLS and ACLS certification required;
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $58.00 - $63.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Medical Specialty:

* Medical-Surgical

Physical Setting:

* Ambulatory surgery center
* Hospital

title: R-050304 Pest Control Consultant
description:
**Benefits Start Day 1 for Full-Time Colleagues - No Waiting Period!**  
For more information about our benefits, see below!

We are proud to be a member of the Rentokil family of companies, the global leader in Pest Control and other services across more than 90 countries. We pride ourselves on being a trusted partner to many of the world's leading brands and serve consumer and business customers across multiple industries. We are extremely proud of our legacy of excellence and constantly work to fulfill our mission to "protect people, enhance lives, and preserve the planet."

**\\*Position Overview**\\*Sells business unit products and services to owners or agents of homes, stores or industries. Conducts inspections to identify infestations or conditions conducive to infestations of wood destroying organisms and/or insects, birds, or other vertebrate pests. Prepares proposals and presentations to obtain sales contracts. Assists in the collection of payments and scheduling of services.

**\\*Job Responsibilities**\\*

* Sells business unit products and services to owners or agents of homes, stores, or industry.
* Conducts inspections to identify infestations or conditions conducive to infestations of wood destroying organisms and/or insects, birds, or other vertebrate pests.
* Prepares proposals and presentations to obtain sales contracts.
* Covers sales leads in assigned territory and develops sales leads creatively for each lead furnished.
* Records accurate measurements and writes correct descriptions of property inspected.
* Prepares appropriate specifications and treating instructions in accordance with existing laws, regulations and company policy.
* Computes job-treating cost from company pricing instructions.
* Executes contracts on behalf of the company, observing company policy as to credit terms of sale.
* Manages collection effort on delinquent accounts of personal sales contracts.
* Advises customers about other products and services.
* Deals courteously with customers, leaving customer’s premises and furnishings clean and as found.
* Contacts customers after service is performed to ensure customer satisfaction and to develop additional prospects.
* Reports unusual requests from customers or questions not immediately answerable to direct supervisor.
* Maintains prospect files, call-back files and activity records.
* Maintains equipment, vehicle and personal safety equipment in clean, working order.
* Examines architectural drawings and specifications; prepares estimates for soil pre- treatment bids.
* Completes appropriate training courses as assigned.
* Aware of location and telephone number of local poison control centers.

**\\*Job Requirements**\\*

* High school diploma or general education diploma (GED) required
* Bachelor's Degree or an equivalent combination of college and experience preferred
* 2 years related experience and/or training in sales and dealing with the public; or equivalent combination of training and experience preferred Maintains knowledge of pests and chemicals used in treatment
* Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos
* Ability to write correspondence
* Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization
* Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals
* Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs
* Skill in creating sales leads and cross-selling company products and services
* Maintains appearance of uniform as directed by company policy
* Maintains relevant licenses as required by federal, state or local regulations for termite/pest control and any other business unit products and services
* Maintains a valid driver’s license

**\\*Physical Demands and Working Conditions**\\*The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential function to this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  
**Incumbent must be prepared to:**

* Move up to 10 pounds occasionally, by lifting, carrying, pushing, pulling, or otherwise repositioning objects.

* Fingering and Repetitive motions; such as movement of wrists, hands and fingers while picking, pinching and typing during your normal working environment.
* Express or exchange ideas with others through the use of spoken word, quickly, accurately, and at an easily audible volume, and receive detailed information through oral communication at usual speaking levels without correction, and/or make fine discriminations in the nature of sounds in the environment.

**Incumbent is required to have:** 

* Close visual acuity to perform detail oriented activities at distances close to the eyes, as well as visual acuity to perform activities at or within arm’s reach with skill, control, and accuracy, such as preparing and analyzing data, viewing computer screen and expansive reading.

**Incumbent will be subject to:**

* Inside working conditions: The change of building environment such as with or without air conditioning and heating.

title: Assistant Manager
description:
As Assistant Manager, you’ll be joining a world class Company that has 130 years of experience servicing our customers and providing great jobs for great people like you! At Sunoco, our employees come first and when you join us you are joining a family! This is an hourly non-exempt full-time position reporting directly to the General Manager.


Your mission is to ensure that your customers and employees experience a friendly, safe, and enjoyable store experience that results in repeat business and a high performance team. Join us in our commitment to serving our local communities and maintaining our iconic American brand. We offer a competitive hourly rate, health insurance, a retirement plan, and abundant fast track career opportunities! Our mission is to ensure that our customers and employees experience a friendly, safe, and enjoyable store experience that results in repeat business and a high performance team.


Additionally, we offer the following bonuses:


**Sign On Bonus:**


* $500 for all new hires with 0-2 years of relevant experience
* $750 for all new hires with 2-3 years of relevant experience
* $1,000 for all new hires with 3+ years of relevant experience
	+ This bonus to be paid out in three increments: 25% after 30 days, 25% after 60 days, 50% after 180 days
	+ The referred employee be active at the time of bonus payment and in good standing

**Referral bonus:**


* $1,000 for successfully referring a new hire to the store
	+ This bonus to be paid out in three increments: $250 after 30 days, $250 after 60 days, and $500 after 180 days
	+ The referred employee must be active at the time of bonus payment and in good standing

**General Responsibilities:**


* Assist the General Manager with the efficient and effective management of the facility and managing the location in the absence of the General Manager
* Provide excellent customer service and effectively manage employees during absence of manager, including addressing employee relations issues
* Manage expenses, merchandizing, profits and losses to ensure the financial stability of the operation; banking and completing DSR and shift analysis reports
* Conduct competitor surveys at the direction of management using personal vehicle
* Available to work any day and any shift as required.


**Qualifications/Experience/Education:**


* Customer service, leadership, & basic computer skills
* Retail experience is a plus but not required (we will train you!)
* Valid driver’s license is required to perform banking responsibilities and to conduct competitor surveys. Reliable transportation and valid automobile insurance is required
* Ability to lift/carry up to 25 pounds and operate a dolly/handcart for heavier items
* Previous customer service experience is a plus
* High school diploma or general education degree (GED) is preferred, or equivalent experience.

  

  

**An equal opportunity employer/disability/vet**  

  

Energy Transfer is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against qualified applicants on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information, citizenship status, or any other basis prohibited by law.
  

  

The nature and frequency of the above working conditions and requirements may vary depending on individual operational circumstances. Where feasible, the Partnership will make reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities to enable them to perform the essential functions of the job.
  

  

**DISCLAIMER:**  

The statements listed in this job posting, which are subject to change, are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.

title: Real Estate Internship
description:
Job Title: Commercial Real Estate | Bridge Lender | Intern

Yellow Jacket is a leading commercial real estate company in New York, specializing in acquiring, managing, and developing residential commercial real estate.

In our lending division, we provide multi million dollar bridge loans to real estate investors and developers, ensuring swift financing solutions.

Our company is experiencing significant growth as we expand our portfolio and increase our bridge loan offerings. With the demand for flexible financing and real estate solutions rising, we are seeking talented individuals to join our team and support our continued success in this fast-paced market.

Position Overview:  
We are seeking a motivated intern to join our dynamic team.

This position is ideal for someone interested in gaining hands-on experience in the commercial real estate industry, particularly in the areas of commercial housing and bridge loans. Must be able to assist with various clerical and administrative tasks and posess superior customer service skills.

Key Responsibilities:

* Assist in the documentation and management of the real estate portfolio and bridge loans.
* Assistance to In House Counsel: Prepare legal notices, make post office runs, scan and label work
* Provide general clerical support, including data entry, file management, and maintaining real estate and loan documentation.
* Support the team in the preparation of loan applications, reports, and presentations.
* Assist in client communications and provide excellent customer service to both borrowers and tenants.
* Conduct market research on commercial real estate trends in New York and assist in analyzing new investment opportunities.
* Help coordinate meetings and events for both internal and external stakeholders.
* Participate in special projects and assist with other tasks as needed.

Qualifications:

* High School diploma
* Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and customer service skills.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and basic understanding of Google Workspace.
* Ability to multitask and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
* Prior knowledge of or experience in commercial real estate is a plus but not required.

What You'll Gain:

* Insight into the commercial real estate industry, and bridge financing.
* Hands-on experience in loan processing and real estate management.
* Networking opportunities with industry professionals and potential future employers.
* An understanding of New York’s real estate market and financial services landscape.

Resume must contain contact information; email and phone number.

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $15.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 20 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

License/Certification:

* Real Estate License (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY 11210 (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY 11210: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Service Tech II
description:
Job Summary:



Under the direction of the Service Director and Real Estate Manager, the Service Technician II is responsible for performing general maintenance, grounds, and housekeeping services to ensure excellent curb appeal and quality of apartment homes and responding to customer service requests.



Essential Duties ad Responsibilites:



Maintenance Services:


* Perform preventative maintenance, repairs, inspections, and janitorial services as assigned
* Assist with maintenance of storage area and maintenance materials
* Perform refurbishing and renovation of apartments per company standards
* Walk the property daily to ensure curb appeal and quality of apartments
* Notify RE Manager of any safety concerns and participate in safety meetings
* Responsible for knowledge of property specific problems such as asbestos
* Assist in snow removal as required
* Perform other duties as required
* Maintain accurate record of all tasks completed
* Ability to trouble shoot appliances, electrical plumbing and HVAC
* Assist with inventories of supplies


Customer Service:


* Complete all service requests in accordance with company standards
* Available for weekend work, on-call duties, and after-hours emergency service requests, 24 hours per day, 7 days per week as schedule


Requirements:


* High school diploma or equivalent preferred
* CFC Type I & II may be required
* Valid Driver’s License
* At least 1-2 years of maintenance experience
* Excellent English communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Ability to walk the grounds and apartments, ascend stairs around the property, lift 60 lbs., climb ladders no higher than 10 feet, and perform other general physical activities such as bending, kneeling, pushing
* Sufficient knowledge to thoroughly complete maintenance assessment up to the standards of a Service Technician II
* Ability to stand for extended period of hours
* Pay Range: $22/hr - $23/hr

#### **Licenses & Certifications**


Preferred* OSHA 30hr Course
* EPA 608-1 TYPE1 HVAC
* EPA 608-2 TYPE2 HVAC
* EPA 608-3 TYPE3 HVAC-LP
* EPA Universal Cert-HVAC

#### **Skills**


Preferred* Plumbing
* Painting
* Real Page
* Microsoft Office Suite
* Site Inspections
* Hot Water Systems
* Electrical
* Drywall
* Customer Service
* Apartment Maintenance

title: Front Desk Clerk
description:
**Front Desk & Guest Care**



We are looking for people that have a passion to serve others! Working at the front desk means you are at the hub of the hotel with the most interaction with our guests. Your role is key to the overall experience the guest will have. Your keen sense of being proactive, responsive and caring will make all the difference. If you enjoy engaging with others and have a winning personality and high sense of responsibility – this role is perfect for you! We have a great company culture at Concord Hospitality where everyone is valued and treated with respect.


**Role Responsibilities:**



As a Front Desk Clerk or Guest Services Clerk you have the responsibility to give our guests the best hospitality experience they can have by:


* Assisting guests efficiently, courteously and professionally at all times.
* Maintain a high level of service and hospitality.
* Promptly and effectively deal with guest concerns or issues and see all are met to satisfaction in timely manner.
* Post guest charges, collect payments and follow all cash handling procedures as required by Concord.
* Handle guest mail and messages with respect to privacy and professionalism.
* Be knowledgeable of the hotel brand and various programs (travel programs, special offers).
* Be a great communicator to various departments and management on guest comments and concerns.
* Respond quickly to incoming calls, lobby visitors and team members needing front desk assistance.
* Have full knowledge of hotel safety and emergency procedures.


Here are some reasons our associates like working for us:


**Benefits (Full Time Associates only)**



We offer competitive wages. Full-time associates are eligible to participate in a comprehensive benefit package, which includes medical/dental/vision plans, life insurance, ST/LT disability options, 401K options, tuition assistance, discounted room rates at Concord managed hotels, plus training & development and career advancement opportunities.


**Why Concord?**



Our culture is based on our five Cornerstones and they are what we consider our foundation: Quality, Integrity, Community, Profitability, and Fun. It’s important to us to provide a great work environment for our associates and we strive to hire the BEST associates in the market. At Concord, you can enjoy a culture where you are valued and our Associate First policy is a way of life. Utilize your hospitality talents with a Company that cares about you and your development. We do many fun things on property to stay engaged with our associates and show you we care about you.

  



If you are seeking a position where you can grow and be a part of a fun team, this job may be your answer. We are proud to be an EEO employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace.

title: New York, NY Part-Time SAT Tutor (Manhattan Elite Prep)
description:
Manhattan Elite Prep is a multi-national educational services firm with over 10 years of experiences in the test prep, admissions consulting and career training industry. Since the inception, we have grown into a multi-national firm, focusing on helping students achieve the highest GMAT, GRE, TOEFL, SAT, ACT, LSAT & MCAT scores with the least amount of time and financial investments. Additionally, we offer assistance with college, business and graduate school admissions consulting, application advisory and essay editing services.

We also offer private tutoring for all K-12 academic subjects including math, English, history and more. For more information, please visit https://www.manhattaneliteprep.com.

Job Description:

**Test subject needed: SAT**

We are looking for experienced SAT test prep teachers and/or tutors who have a strong interest in guiding local students and can engage students on all levels.  
**The best fit will be someone who has taken the same test(s), has experience of teaching the tests, has strong professional ethics,** is co-operative with the company's management and administrative staff, enjoys teaching, has flexible schedule for evenings and weekends, and enjoys being part of a growing company and making meaningful contributions. Admissions Consulting experience such as essay review also preferred.  
Qualifications:

-Based in the city of New York, NY (or within short travel distance)

-Top official (non-mock) test score (please attach original report); Other official test score reports if available. If official test score is not available, mock test scores will be considered

-A track record of excellent teaching and/or tutoring experience for the same test or similar test

-A degree from a recognized college or post-graduate program preferred, All Ph.D. candidates or graduates welcome

-Flexible with providing different services in teaching, tutoring, and consulting

-High proficiency & fluency in English desired

-Solid computer skills

-**Your application must include the following:**

-Official or mock test scores with test dates (Not required for TOEFL/IELTS)  
-Cover letter or email detailing prior teaching experience  
-Resume  
\\*PLEASE NOTE: In any response please use the following as an example for your email subject line: SAT INSTRUCTOR - New York, NY - XXX (APPLICANT'S FULL NAME) -SAT SCORE: XXX

If you do not format your subject line according to the above example, your candidacy will not be considered. Thank you again for your time.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $25.00 - $30.00 per hour

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10175 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Director, Finance - Alternative Risk Solutions
description:
This is an opportunity to join Ascot Group - one of the world’s preeminent specialty risk underwriting organizations.


Designed as a modern-era company operating through an ecosystem of interconnected global operating platforms, we’re bound by a common mission and purpose. Our greatest strength is a talented team who flourish in a collaborative, inclusive, and entrepreneurial culture, steeped in underwriting excellence, integrity, and a passion to find a better way, ***The Ascot Way*** .


The Ascot Way guides our people and our organization. Our underwriting platforms collaborate to find creative ways to deploy our capital in a true cross-product and cross-platform approach. These platforms work as one, deploying our capital creatively through our Client Centric, Risk Centric and Technology Centric strategies


Built to be resilient, Ascot offers clients leading financial security while delivering bespoke products and world class service — both pre- and post-claims. Ascot exists to solve for our clients’ brightest tomorrow, through agility, collaboration, resilience, and discipline.


**Position Summary:**

The **Director, Finance – Alternative Risk Solutions** will report directly to the U.S. CFO, with a matrix to business leadership. This role will oversee the unit’s financial operations and strategic planning, focusing on captive solutions, fronting opportunities, and the development of future growth capabilities in alternative risk transfer mechanisms, including structured risk solutions, parametric products, and loss portfolio transfer products. The ideal candidate will have a growth mindset and the ability to financially guide the development of creative risk solutions to the complex problems of our valued trading partners.


**Primary Responsibilities and Duties:**

* Partner with underwriting, finance, and reinsurance operations functions to provide business performance and insights as we look to build for long-term value.
* Work directly with the US executive leadership team to evaluate and propose mutually beneficial deal economics with potential trading partners including captive managers.
* Perform all finance business partner duties including monthly/quarterly financial statements preparation and analytics, participate in profitability reviews across internal stakeholders, financial planning & analysis, and ad-hoc reporting.
* Serve as the primary financial contact for trading partners, and partner with the US executive team on driving long-term value creation and business strategy.
* Collaborate with internal/external parties on the transactional aspects of the business including reinsurance agreements, changes to collateral, bookings, etc. Coordinate captives credit review to limit financial risk.
* Partner with Treasury on trust fund review, monitoring, and cash flows.
* Participate with the reinsurance operations leader to stand up the ceding arrangement pre- and post-implementation of our reinsurance solution.
* Develop multi-year financial projections that have documented strategies and action plans for delivery.
* Coordinate the timely handling of cash flows including premiums, claim recoverables, and collateral. Monitor existing collateral for adequacy.
* Other financial assignments assisting the broader Ascot US enterprise as needed.
Commitment to The Ascot Way: As a senior member of the finance organization, the Director, Finance – Alternative Risk Solutions will embody The Ascot Way in their daily interaction with colleagues, fostering colleague engagement and development, collaboration, inclusivity, and individual accountability.  
* 

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting/Finance. CPA is a plus.
* At least 8 years of insurance leadership and people management experience in insurance accounting and finance.
* Experience with Alternative Risk products required.
* Motivational leadership skills, a track record of driving for results, and collaborating effectively in a team environment.
* Adept at building key stakeholder relationships externally and internally.
* Superior oral, written, and presentation skills with the ability to influence decisions.
* Demonstrated business savvy with strong strategic, analytical, and quantitative skills, and internal thought leadership.
* Skilled leader of change; versatile, client-focused, results-oriented.
* Strong problem-solving and conflict resolution skills; ability to challenge effectively both people and portfolio strategy with the ability to effect change where appropriate.
* Strong influencing and communication skills and ability to work across multiple areas of the company and industries.
* Expert in operational and transactional excellence.
* Ability to travel as needed and with short notice.

\\*\\*\\*This position may be filled at a different level, depending on experience\\*\\*\\*


**Compensation**

Actual base pay could vary and may be above or below the listed range based on factors including but not limited to experience, subject matter expertise, and skills. The base pay is just one component of Ascot’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include annual cash bonus, long-term incentives, and other forms of discretionary compensation awarded by the Company.


* The annualized base pay range for this role in New York - $185,000 - $205,000.

**Company Benefits**

The Company provides a competitive benefits package that includes the following (eligibility requirements apply):


Health and Welfare Benefits: Medical (including prescription coverage), Dental, Vision, Health Savings Account, Commuter Account, Health Care and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts, Life Insurance, AD&D, Work/Life Resources (including Employee Assistance Program), and more.


Leave Benefits: Paid holidays, annual Paid Time Off (includes paid state /local paid leave where required), Short-term Disability, Long-term Disability, Other leaves (e.g., Bereavement, FMLA, Adoption, Maternity, Military, Primary & Non-Primary Caregiver)


Retirement Benefits: Contributory Savings Plan (401k)

title: Hotel Front Desk Supervisor/Manager on Duty
company: Fairfield Inn by Marriott JFK Airport
description:
***MUST have Hotel Experience and Management Experience to apply. Open availability as well.*** 

**As a hotel Operations Manager**, you will be responsible for providing oversight and staff management, for all functions within the hotel Operations departments, including Front Office, Housekeeping, and Engineering/Maintenance. You will strive to continually improve guest and employee satisfaction, and to maximize the financial performance of the department, while ensuring that standards and procedures are consistently being followed.

**Your specific duties in this role will include:**

* Creating and nurturing a work environment that emphasizes motivation, empowerment, teamwork, continuous improvement, and a passion for providing service
* Examining employee and guest satisfaction results, and developing game plans to attack need areas while expanding on areas of strength
* Providing excellent customer service by being readily available to and approachable for all guests
* Addressing guest concerns in a proactive manner
* Ensuring that all team members meet or exceed all hospitality requirements
* Assisting in performing required annual Quality audit with GM
* Interviewing candidates and assisting in making hiring decisions

title: Retail Merchandiser
description:
Join **Hallmark** as a **Part-Time Retail Merchandiser** in **Brooklyn, NY**! This is your opportunity to represent the world's best-known greeting card brand and play a crucial role in merchandising, creating, and building displays within your territory for a positive shopper experience. We offer you work life integration within the work week, while supporting the business needs. You will be required to service stores based on the scheduling tool you are provided. We offer paid: training, travel time, and mileage reimbursement. Are you ready to **make your mark**?


**JOB OVERVIEW**  

As a Retail Merchandiser, you'll have the opportunity to work independently to showcase your organization and time management skills, your ability to establish retailer relationships, while being the face of Hallmark. You will collaborate with local store teams to optimize product placement and maintain inventory levels as well as support fellow team members with seasonal resets and installations, when needed. On occasion Hallmark may ask you to service another vendor's product in a store that you are assigned to. If that is the case, you will be provided detailed instructions and additional budgeted time.

  




**To learn more about this role, please click** **to watch our retail merchandisers in action.**  

  

**SALARY AND SHIFT DETAILS**

* Your starting pay will be between $16.50 - $16.75 depending on your shift and location.
* This is a Part-Time position with a variable schedule during the work week.
* Weekly hours for this position is between 8 – 10 hours per week
* Availability the week before and after major holidays, which may include weekends is **required**.

  


**YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE**

You'll perform service work in the Hallmark department of various retail stores such as grocery stores, drug stores, department stores, and mass retailers. The retail merchandiser position consists of three major components:


* **Day-to-day engagement:** You are responsible for the entire Hallmark product display at your assigned stores. Utilizing a mobile device provided by Hallmark, you'll restock, organize, and monitor the inventory of Hallmark products within and outside the Hallmark department. While using your mobile device you will also be in communication with your supervisor, reporting time, providing feedback, and answering surveys for required merchandising activities. Professional and courteous interaction with store employees, management, and customers is also vital for success in this role.


* **Holiday support:** Hallmark's operations revolve around seasonal demand. Leading up to and following holidays such as Valentine's Day, Easter, Mother's Day, Father's Day, Halloween, Thanksgiving, and Christmas, you can expect additional days and extended hours during the work week. On occasions like Valentine's Day, Mother's Day, and Father's Day, you may be required to work on the actual holiday itself, which may include the weekend.


* **Department Resets:** At times, you may be part of a team responsible for **installations and various tasks** like building and installing Hallmark fixtures, relocating card departments and products, as well as resetting card sections. Typically, you will be notified two weeks in advance for remodel assignments. This could include evenings or weekend.


* **One Team Vision:** As a field organization although you are assigned to your specific responsibilities there may be additional work and installation efforts that you will be asked and required to support.



**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**


This is a physically demanding job that requires a high level of energy and a sense of urgency. You will be working on the selling floor as well as in back stockrooms. You must be able to consistently push, pull, lift, and carry cartons, merchandise, and display fixtures up to 30 pounds throughout the workday and up to 50 pounds on occasion. You will also be required to stoop, squat, walk, and stand throughout your workday, and you may be required to climb stairs and step ladders.

  




**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* You're at least 18 years of age.
* You're able to read, write and understand English.
* You have the ability to grasp, pull, lift, and carry products up to 30 pounds frequently and 50 pounds occasionally.
* Able to operate hand-held technology provided to open and read documents and interpret information.
* You have access to a Wi-Fi network and the internet.
* You have reliable transportation to report to assigned locations.


**Prior to applying, please click** **to watch retail merchandisers at work.**

  

**Now's your chance to Make Your Mark—just follow the instructions below to apply.**


You must show how you meet the basic qualifications in a resume or document you upload, or by completing the work experience and education application fields. Accepted file types are DOCX and PDF.  

  

Part-time employees with a work schedule less than 30 hours have access to a variety of voluntary benefits through ; including dental, vision, critical illness, accident insurance, hospital indemnity and minimum essential coverage (preventive care).

  




#LI-AM1

title: Marketing Insights Analyst
description:
**Position: Marketing Insights Analyst**

**Location: Parsippany New Jersey**   
**Shift: 1st Shift - Must be local to NJ - onsite in Parsippany**

**Job Description:-**  
Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  
Plans, manages, and delivers Marketing Insights projects. Under the supervision of the Marketing Insights Manager - Enterprise Solutions, executes end-to-end research projects, including requirement gathering, defining research approach/methodology, participant recruitment, research instrument development/programming/testing, analysis and presentation delivery.  
Crafts questionnaires and discussion guides that meet the needs of the business. Leverages in-depth knowledge of survey and discussion guide development best practices to program surveys and qualitative instruments that deliver engaging quantitative and qualitative experiences to our valuable customer base.  
Employs Qualitative research methodologies. This includes moderation of focus groups and in depth interviews as well as the execution of unmoderated user experience testing to gather deeper insights when the need arises.  
Analyzes work and presents research findings to business owners. Provides actionable insights to project owners and stakeholders at all levels of the organization to drive strategy, design recommendations, experience development and product optimization.  
Supports in-person customer insights focus groups and co-creation events. In partnership with events, R&D and Product Marketing owns the end to end management, execution and delivery (from agenda, recruitment, and facilitation to insights dissemination) of an impactful customer insights engagement that provides insight into challenging business questions and product development opportunities (3-6 times a year).  
Supports research needs on request for Residential focused areas including but not limited to Products, Programs, Services and Events.  
Owns insights knowledge management system processes, maintenance, reporting and communications. Manages communication calendar for insights projects, maintains the system to ensure accessibility across the enterprise, trains new users as needed and builds periodic reports to monitor use and performance.

**Responsibilities:-**  
3-7 years of related experience in marketing analytics, marketing research, user experience research or management consulting.  
A Bachelor’s Degree/MBA or advanced degree preferred, preferably with a focus in Statistics, Research, Psychology, Cognitive Science, Anthropology, Human Factors, HCI/CS, Marketing or General Management.  
Advanced experience with quantitative research (survey design, response effects, sampling, crosstabs, and statistical concepts, etc.) and qualitative/user-centered design methods (individual and group interviews, diary studies, direct observation, think-aloud usability testing, etc.).  
Advanced experience with a broad range of Marketing Research tools/technology including Qualtrics, Usertesting.com and other online insights tools  
Advanced experience with Excel, PowerPoint and Word  
Experience working in the Building Materials space. Experience in adjacent complex industries/product categories will be considered.  
Expert facilitation/moderation skills are required.  
Strong stakeholder management and relationship building skills.  
Marketing Research, Customer Experience or User Experience Research certifications preferred.  
Excellent communicator (both written and verbal) with strong business acumen and strong work ethic.  
Demonstrated project management skills and ability to effectively manage a large workload with ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.  
Advanced experience conducting analysis and sharing actionable insights.  
Experience working with and managing research service providers.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $30.00 - $35.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Experience:

* Marketing analytics: 3 years (Required)
* user experience research: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: On the road

The Credentialing Coordinator serves as one of the main resources to administer the credentialing and re-credentialing activities with the team. Ensures all EyeMed providers meet the credentialing requirements for participation.

\\*Supports the preparation of weekly rosters to present providers for committee approvals/denials

title: Civil Litigation Paralegal (Experienced)
description:
**Position: Senior Litigation Paralegal, Fully Remote** 

**About Guards Law:**

At Guards Law, we specialize in Consumer Law, focusing on protecting and advocating for consumer rights with dedication and expertise. Our strength lies not only in our acclaimed attorneys but in every member of our team who embodies our mission. We serve clients across multiple states, leveraging every legal avenue to ensure justice and protection.

Our team is bound by more than camaraderie; it’s a fellowship that drives us to fiercely advocate for our clients. Beyond cases and courtrooms, we aim to make a meaningful impact on society and uplift every member of our Guards Law family in knowledge and spirit.

Guards Law is not just a workplace; it is a beacon for change-makers. Do you resonate with our vision? Our mission is to give our clients an opportunity to reset, regroup, and restart on their journey. Let us embark on this mission together.

**Summary of Opportunity:**

As a pivotal member of our team, you will collaborate closely with our attorneys, diving deep into diverse federal civil litigation challenges. Your role is not just supportive; you are at the very heart of our strategic approach, navigating case files and processes through every twist and turn of litigation.

Leveraging state-of-the-art litigation tools, you will be an instrumental force in driving our mission forward. We seek individuals with a keen eye for discerning the nuances of promising federal civil litigation cases.

We are looking for someone who is hardworking, loyal to the firm, possesses an excellent work ethic, provides outstanding service to clients, and helps preserve and grow our excellent reputation. If you share these traits, please join us on our mission of service.

**Key Responsibilities:**

1. Draft responses to complaints and other responsive pleadings.

2. Draft and respond to discovery requests for litigation matters.

3. Draft motions and notices for filing.

4. Assist with the preparation of court filings, including cite and fact-checking legal briefs and assembling exhibits and appendices.

5. Prepare for depositions, hearings, and trials.

6. Compile, review, and analyze documents specific to case issues as required by attorneys to determine necessary information.

7. Conduct research (factual, legal, internet, and other) to identify relevant issues and compile findings.

8. Communicate and correspond with clients and outside entities, such as government agencies, expert witnesses, vendors, corporations, and other law firms, to gather information or data.

9. Serve as a factual resource on cases and demonstrate knowledge of case documents.

10. Manage docketing through the firm’s docketing software.

11. Demonstrate proactivity and require minimal training.

**Key Attributes and Abilities:**

1. Compassionate: Shows empathy and thoughtfulness towards others.

2. Supportive and Encouraging: Takes pleasure in uplifting others and recognizing their contributions.

3. Responsible:\\*\\* Takes charge of tasks and ensures accountability.

4. Constructive Feedback:\\*\\* Able to give and receive feedback positively to enhance the mission; confidently advocates for the best interests of Guards Law.

5. Effective Communicator:\\*\\* Exhibits excellent oral and written communication skills for clear interactions with attorneys and staff.

6. Team-Oriented:\\*\\* Works well and professionally with clients and colleagues at all levels, including attorneys, coworkers, and administrators.

7. Initiative-Driven:\\*\\* Proactively takes action, grasps intricate details within a broader scope, and operates with minimal oversight.

8. Flexible:\\*\\* Quickly and positively adapts to changing demands and opportunities.

9. Performs Under Pressure:\\*\\* Manages tight deadlines efficiently, handles multiple tasks simultaneously, sets priorities wisely, and delegates when needed.

10. Decision Maker:\\*\\* Foresees issues, exercises sound judgment, makes well-founded decisions, and knows when to escalate matters.

11. Quality-Focused:\\*\\* Produces superior work and ensures follow-through on responsibilities.

12. Self-Reliant and Cooperative:\\*\\* Works independently with minimal supervision while being a cooperative team member in a dynamic environment.

13. Remote Work Savvy:\\*\\* Operates effectively in remote settings and in diverse cultural and educational environments.

14. Lifelong Learner:\\*\\* Seeks feedback and continuously develops professionally by acquiring new skills.

**Education, Experience, and Legal Competencies Needed:**

* Extensive interaction with attorneys and other paralegals requires superior interpersonal, verbal, and written communication abilities.
* Ideally, a minimum of five years of paralegal experience in federal civil litigation.
* Should be well-versed in the CM/ECF electronic filing system utilized in federal courts, along with a thorough knowledge of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, or exhibit the capability and eagerness to swiftly master these areas.

**Compensation:**

The starting salary for this position is $55,000 annually.

**Benefits:**

- Health insurance

- Dental insurance

- Vision insurance

- Paid time off

**Job Type:**

- Full-time

- In Office

**Pay:**

$55,000 per year

**Schedule:**

- 8-hour shift: 8:30 AM EST - 5:30 PM EST

**Travel requirement:**

- No travel

Join us in our mission to protect and serve consumers with integrity and dedication. Apply now to be part of the Guards Law team. www.GuardsLaw.com

title: Host/Hostess
description:
*Game Master (Please Answer Questionnaire)*   
**Mission Escape Games is New York City's Premier Escape Games entertainment provider. Established in February 2014 in New York City, Mission Escape Games paved the way in creating some of the most immersive escape room experiences in the Nation. Nominated in 2016 as one of the 10 Best Escape Rooms in the Country, the owners and staff constantly strive to deliver unique and unrivaled experiences for their customers that they'll never forget!**

**Our organization is looking for top-tier candidates to build a team in our Time Square, NYC location who love to work in a cooperative and collaborative environment. If you love to provide exceptional customer service, are a Great Storyteller (Definitely a plus), and build memories that last a lifetime, then look no further and apply with Mission Escape Games in Midtown Manhattan today!**

**Provide us with your most current resume and complete the questions below to start your application process today! Incomplete Job Applications will not be reviewed unfortunately, so please make sure to complete all the steps.**

**Please send all resumes via email, include any applicable references, and COMPLETE ANSWERS from the questionnaire. Unfortunately due to the influx of applications you will only be contacted once your application has been screened thoroughly by our staff members. Please be patient with us as we continue reviewing all of the candidates.**

* **Are you coach-able and can admit your mistakes?**

**Competencies & Responsibilities:**

**Provide an exceptional experience for all customers.**

**100% attention to the game you are running.**

**100% customer service in making reservations over the phone/walk-ins**

**Quick learner with our booking system**

**Making sure the room is ready for your guest.**

**Answering questions which the guest might have.**

**Intro and Post game.**

**Greet guests sincerely - past, present and future.**

**Maintain ongoing facility cleanliness to ensure a clean and inviting environment for guests.**

**Be able to repair/replace items when necessary.**

**Must be flexible in scheduling and available late afternoons, nights, weekends and on short notice.**

**Ability to work independently but also work well with a team.**

**Possess great listening skills.**

**Learning new creative skills and solutions.**

**Work Together as a team with fellow Staff Members**

**Cleaning**

**Mission Escape Games is looking for the exemplary candidate as someone who can work well with fellow team members and ultimately provide a memorable experience for all of our customers. If you've played escape rooms before and have a great understanding of the process we encourage you to apply.**

**We look forward to having you as part of our amazing staff at Mission Escape Games. Best of luck!**

title: Direct Support Professional (Youth Respite)
description:
**Summary:** Empower U. is a dynamic in-home, a mental health organization that is rapidly growing each year. Empower U. provides Respite services to children with developmental disabilities between the ages of 5 and 21, who are seeking services after school and after work hours. We are seeking highly motivated, professional, respite technicians for part-time and per-diem positions. This position is for our Agency Hired Respite (AHR) and Agency Weekend Respite (AWR) departments.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Provide direct care for children and families with a wide array of disabilities.
* Provide assistance to families by taking youth out into the community and engaging with others.
* Provide necessary resources and support system development.
* Assist youth with activities of daily living.
* Provides supportive peer counseling, friendly and understanding conversation.
* Assists you with steps required to take care of their physical needs, and participate in the maintenance of a clean-living environment.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Ability to utilize critical thinking, problem-solving and de-escalation skills.
* Completes all required training successfully and regularly attends mandatory respite meetings and supervision meetings to provide input regarding the program.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**Education and skills:**

* High School diploma (Required)
* College student major in Psychology, Social Work, Applied Behavior Analysis and Special Education (Preferred)
* Home Health Aide Experience (Preferred)
* Flexible lifestyle that will allow you to work after school, evening, and/or weekend hours.
* Fluency in languages in addition to English is a plus
* Self-motivated
* Ability to multi-task throughout the entire shift
* Willing to travel to neighboring counties within a 10-15-mile radius
* Minimum of six months of experience working with children with developmental disabilities
* A working smartphone to utilize our applications
* Driver's license with a clean abstract (Required)

title: Sales Coordinator - East
description:
**General Description**



Our mission is to deliver the dream of flight! iFLY is a global company with over 40 U.S. locations. This is an exciting opportunity to join an established, successful, innovative company that supports your professional development.



As a Sales Coordinator, you will be the driving force behind our efforts to increase sales and customer satisfaction for our diverse range of event options, focusing on birthday planning. You will manage inbound inquiries, provide exceptional customer service, and drive year-over-year (YOY) growth across multiple markets nationwide. Your role will be pivotal in creating memorable experiences for clients while achieving sales targets and expanding our market reach.

  


**Duties and Responsibilities**


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Handle inbound calls and inquiries regarding birthday packages with professionalism and enthusiasm.
* Provide detailed information about various packages, including features, pricing, and customization options.
* Utilize a consultative sales approach to match clients with the best birthday package for their needs.
* Upsell additional services or products to enhance the overall experience and increase sales revenue.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with clients by offering personalized service and follow-up.
* Address and resolve any concerns or issues promptly and effectively.
* Analyze market trends and customer feedback to identify opportunities for growth and improvement.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and implement strategies for various markets.
* Monitor sales performance and track key metrics to ensure YOY growth targets are met.
* Present regular reports on sales activities, customer feedback, and market trends.

  


**Work Experience and Requirements**


**Required Qualifications:**


* Minimum 1 year experience in sales or customer service, preferably in a similar role.
* Exceptional communication skills with the ability to engage and persuade potential clients.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a remote setting.
* Proficiency in CRM software (Hubspot experience a plus) and Microsoft Office Suite.
* A positive attitude and a passion for delivering outstanding customer experiences.

  


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Experience in the event planning or hospitality industry.
* Knowledge of various birthday package options and trends.
* Previous experience working with a nationwide client base.

  


**The Good Stuff**


* Competitive Salary and performance bonus opportunities
* $50k Starting salary and additional in commission
* Medical, dental, vision and supplemental plans
* Paid time off (PTO) and;
	+ Parental Leave
	+ Company Holidays
* 401k retirement investment with generous company match
* Private Wellness Coaching
* Employee Assistance Programs (F2F counseling, financial coaching, legal counseling & mediation services)
* Tuition reimbursement
* Referral bonus program
* Team member discount on retail merchandise and flight packages
* Free flight time for team members and family
* Ongoing training and development programs

  


* This document is not an exhaustive list of every task this position will be asked or expected to perform. The primary responsibility of all iFLY Team Members is to prioritize their activities based on the needs of the business. As iFLY continues to grow and evolve, so will the duties of our Team Members.


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Fitness Fun Facilitator
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Employee discounts
* Flexible schedule
* Free uniforms
* Opportunity for advancement
  

  

  

Does work have to be... *work*?  

We like to work hard and play harder because we're big kids at heart (iykyk).  

  

My Gym is a vibe ❤️. A really fun, positive, happy one! Brush your hair, pull on some joggers and socks, and WORK IT.  

  

When we say #ily, we mean it - snacks, living wages, and tips are all part of the pkg. Plus a flexible sched, cake on the weekends, and a chill work fam who cares about you.  

  

**Who are you?**  

* Someone who is high-energy, loves to play, be silly, and thinks corn isn’t cringe. ‍ ️‍ ️
* A warm friend. A team player who follows through and always gives
* Reliable and communicative. Our kids will bond with you, so ghosts need not apply.

  

  

**Your skill set:**  

* A genuine love for young children – from babies to upper elementary ages
* Ability to work 20+ hours per week, **including weekends**
* Commitment to train hard and take direction well/easily
* Stage presence – if the idea of performing sounds scary, we might not be the right fit for you
* Willingness to clean (cleaning is a huge part of what we do – it’s how we keep each other and our kids safe & healthy!)
* Effective leadership and motivational skills
* A background in dance, sports, theatre, or fitness is a huuuuge plus!

  

**What’s in it for you:**  

Pay starts at $18-$20 per hour depending on experience.  

But wait! There’s more:  

* Upward mobility – we promote from within!
* Tips! Our families are very generous and take good care of our party hosts on weekends.
* Paid Time Off for Full Time Employees - work/life balance is important to us ❤️

  

  

Check out this video to see My Gym!  

  

At My Gym, you not only have the opportunity to become the face of the #1 children’s enrichment program ***worldwide*** in your community, but also to be a part of an even larger team at Momentum Enterprises, whose mission is to Create an Atmosphere of Optimism for everyone we encounter.  

  

**Think you’re what we’re looking for?**  

Send us your resume, and, if you really want to stand out from the crowd, also attach a short bio or link to yourself on video and tell us why you want to be a part of our fam. ‍‍‍‍‍‍  

  

This My Gym location is operated with love and passion and fun energy by the limitless **Momentum Enterprises**team,with locations hiring in**:**  

  

**MASSACHUSETTS:** Boston, Burlington, Framingham, Medfield, Newton  

**CONNECTICUT:** Fairfield, Glastonbury, Stamford  

**NEW YORK:** Harlem, Yorktown Heights  

  

Every business operated by Momentum Enterprises is driven by this purpose and our Core Values - PEOPLE, LOVE, and FUN. So when it comes to qualifications, we look for limitless people who operate with love, passion, and fun energy.  

  

  

#ZR  

This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of that franchise. All inquiries about employment at this franchise should be made directly to the franchisee, and not to My Gym Corporate.
